title: 109_hr1568
content: Estate and gift tax rates reduced to 30 percent. The estate tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce rates to 30 percent for taxable estates and adjusted taxable gifts made after December 31, 1976. The estate tax rates were reduced to 30 percent for taxable estates and adjusted taxable gifts made after December 31, 1976. Amendments were made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the computation of tax and gifts made by the decedent. The estate tax rates were reduced to 30 percent for taxable estates and adjusted taxable gifts made after December 31, 1976. Amendments were made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding gifts made by the decedent. Subsection (b) of section 2102 was amended to increase the amounts from $13,000 to $20,000 and from $46,800 to $52,500. Section 2201 was also amended to adjust the tax determination under subsection (c) to be deemed under section 2001(b). Amendments were made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including striking the word "tentative" in subsection (c) and updating the gift tax in section 2502. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 updated the gift tax rate in section 2502. The gift tax rate under section 2501 is set at 30% of taxable gifts for each calendar year, with the donor being responsible for paying the tax. Amendments include the repeal of sections 2504 and 901 of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001. The amendments made by subtitles in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are repealed, and the Code shall be applied as if those subtitles had never been enacted. Conforming amendments in the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are also repealed. These changes apply to estates of decedents dying and gifts made after the enactment of this Act. Unified credit increased to equivalent of $10,000,000 exclusion; inflation adjustment of unified credit. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the applicable credit amount to $10,000,000 for tax computation purposes. Additionally, a cost-of-living adjustment is introduced for decedents and gifts made after 2005. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the applicable credit amount to $10,000,000 for tax computation purposes, with a cost-of-living adjustment for decedents and gifts made after 2005. The amendments made by this section shall apply to estates of decedents dying, and gifts made, after the date of the enactment of this Act. Annual gift tax exclusion increased to $50,000 from $10,000 in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The inflation adjustment is reset to 2005, and the effective date for gifts made after December 31, 2004.
